Comment: The King's Gambit leads to games that can be called a lot of things. "Slow", "boring" and "positional" are not on the list.
"The best way to refute a gambit is to accept it." -- Wilhelm Steinitz
Otherwise I would have to contend with a potential ...Q-R5 ch.
This weakening move allows a line-clearing sacrifice...
Black may as well accept the Knight. White's next move cannot be prevented.
This devastating stroke is the beginning of the end.
Pressing onwards. 7... K-K1 loses a Rook to 8 Q-K5 ch, and 7 K-Q3 leaves the King exposed and the hunt would begin in earnest... after White wins the Queen with 8 QxQ.
In light of the last note, Black tries interposing. However...
... he overlooks this bolt from the blue! Game over.
